messages.author: John Grabowski
messages.text: place with other IBOutlets

messages.author: mrossetti
messages.text:
On 2009/11/04 18:22:10, John Grabowski wrote:
> place with other IBOutlets

Done.

messages.author: pink
messages.text: why not just return these in a single line rather than breaking it up into decl + return? It's not like you're really going to need to debug this method, it's pretty simple.

messages.author: pink
messages.text: no need for parens

messages.author: pink
messages.text:
continuation lines indent an additional 4 spaces.

however, you should probably use GetNSStringWithFixup() as it does what you need.

messages.author: pink
messages.text: you probalby mean "non-empty", since blank titles are technically allowed.

messages.author: pink
messages.text: doesn't this get us back to the case where you can't have a whitespace-only name for a title? Didn't we already decide this was ok? Or am I confused?

messages.author: pink
messages.text: this dialog is window-modal, so what happens if while the user is filling it out, the user makes a different window frontmost? Won't it grab the Browser for the wrong window?

messages.author: pink
messages.text: It makes me sad that the bookmark code has to know about the tab model. Is there no way to abstract this?

messages.author: pink
messages.text:
On 2009/11/04 14:24:16, pink wrote:
> this dialog is window-modal, so what happens if while the user is filling it
> out, the user makes a different window frontmost? Won't it grab the Browser for
> the wrong window?

Never mind, clearly this is wrong (since the window has to be frontmost to OK the dialog), but I can't remove this comment.

messages.author: John Grabowski
John Grabowski
messages.text: Sure, it's the same as bookmarkAllTabs_ = bookmarkAllTabs, but it doesn't match other calls right here so seems like there is more hidden.

messages.author: John Grabowski
messages.text:
On 2009/11/04 14:24:16, pink wrote:
> continuation lines indent an additional 4 spaces.
> 
> however, you should probably use GetNSStringWithFixup() as it does what you
> need.

ditto pink's comment

messages.author: John Grabowski
messages.text: Abstract this loop into a method called TabContentThingies: which returns a std::vector of std::pair<Title,URL>.  See next file for more info on why.

> pretty simple.

messages.author: mrossetti
messages.text:
On 2009/11/04 18:22:10, John Grabowski wrote:
> Overall comment for entire file: you've got a number of
> if (bookmarkAlLTabs) {  }
> conditionals in a number of functions.  It's not messy per se but is headed in
> that direction.  Wouldn't subclassing make this simpler? 

Done.

messages.author: John Grabowski
messages.text:
A "TODO" is not OK here.
Either fix 10899 or abstract out calls to TabContents (see TabContentThingies: comment in other file) so that you can override it in your unit test and make everything else work fine.

messages.text:
